text:
It's been a while, but according to Jeff Turner[1]:

  The workaround for now is to manually revert the breadcrumbs.js
  in xml-site/

Just in case that was a problem, I'm submitting a "clean" breadcrumb.js file (hence the presence of 
'[PATCH]' in the subject). I don't know if it'll completely "fix" the problem (it should!), but it certainly 
couldn't hurt!

Web Maestro Clay

[1]
http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=forrest-dev&m=107212331202463&w=2
creator: the.webmaestro@gmail.com
the.webmaestro@gmail.com
text:
Actually, the path is more like:

"xml-fop/build/site/skin/breadcrumbs.js"
"xml-fop/build/site/skin/breadcrumbs-optimized.js"

:-)

creator: glenmazza@yahoo.com
text: I don't think this has been applied yet, correct?  I'm reopening...

It looks like I'll have to wait before applying this--for some reason I wasn't
given write access to xml-site (I believe FOP members get it by default). 
Anyway I've notified infrastructure and Jeff of the Forrest team about it.

Glen
creator: glenmazza@yahoo.com
glenmazza@yahoo.com
text:
I think we've done what we can do on this issue. 

We just need to keep reverting the breadcrumbs.js file in
xml-site/targets/fop/skin everytime we do a publish, until the forrestbot
version is updated:

http://issues.cocoondev.org/jira//secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=FOR-129

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
